Title: Analista de datos con Power Bi & Python
Description:
📢 🔎 Desde ACCOM, empresa de Marketing Digital orientada en ventas, buscamos nuevo/a compi como Data Analyst con 2 años de experiencia, para que se incorpore a nuestro Equipo de Data & BI!




💡 ¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Conocimientos en SQL avanzado, desarrollo, gestión y rendimiento.
Experiencia en infraestructura de Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Dominio en manejo de herramientas de visualización (PowerBI).
Conocimiento en Python.
Habilidades en analítica de datos orientado a resultados de negocio.
Grado en Estadística, Física, Matemáticas, Economía, Ingeniería Informática o similares.




📝 ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?




Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con los equipos de negocio para comprender sus necesidades analíticas y traducirlas en requisitos técnicos y visualizaciones efectivas.
Diseñar, crear y mantener flujos, informes y paneles de Power BI
Proporcionar soporte y capacitación en el uso de Power BI a los usuarios, ayudándoles a aprovechar al máximo la herramienta.
Analizar y optimizar el rendimiento de consultas SQL.
Trabajar en mapeo de datos, flujo de datos y linaje de datos.
Realizar análisis y evaluaciones de datos para identificar áreas de mejora, oportunidades de crecimiento y eficiencias operativas.




📌 ¿Qué ofrecemos?




Accom es una empresa de carácter joven y competitivo en constante crecimiento. Cuidamos mucho nuestra política de Talento y Cultura, buscando siempre la máxima vinculación de las personas con la empresa. Simplemente tratamos a las personas como nos gustaría que nos tratasen.




📈 Participación en la toma de decisiones.
📅 Horario de inicio flexible (entre 8:30 – 9:30).
💻 Posibilidad de teletrabajo en formato híbrido.
💳 Retribución flexible (seguro médico privado, restaurante, transporte y guardería).
📚 Plan formativo acorde a tus necesidades.
💼 Cursos de idiomas ajustados a tu nivel.
🍰 El día de tu cumpleaños libre.
🤼 Eventos y actividades internas para hacer team building.
🏋🏻‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios.
📍 Ubicaciones céntricas en Madrid (Gran vía, Callao).




¡Si crees que eres el perfil que buscamos, estaremos encantados de conocerte!

Show more
HTML:
📢 🔎 Desde ACCOM, empresa de Marketing Digital orientada en ventas, buscamos nuevo/a compi como Data Analyst con 2 años de experiencia, para que se incorpore a nuestro Equipo de Data & BI!


💡 ¿Qué buscamos en ti?


  • Conocimientos en SQL avanzado, desarrollo, gestión y rendimiento.
  • Experiencia en infraestructura de Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
  • Dominio en manejo de herramientas de visualización (PowerBI).
  • Conocimiento en Python.
  • Habilidades en analítica de datos orientado a resultados de negocio.
  • Grado en Estadística, Física, Matemáticas, Economía, Ingeniería Informática o similares.


📝 ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?


  • Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con los equipos de negocio para comprender sus necesidades analíticas y traducirlas en requisitos técnicos y visualizaciones efectivas.
  • Diseñar, crear y mantener flujos, informes y paneles de Power BI
  • Proporcionar soporte y capacitación en el uso de Power BI a los usuarios, ayudándoles a aprovechar al máximo la herramienta.
  • Analizar y optimizar el rendimiento de consultas SQL.
  • Trabajar en mapeo de datos, flujo de datos y linaje de datos.
  • Realizar análisis y evaluaciones de datos para identificar áreas de mejora, oportunidades de crecimiento y eficiencias operativas.


📌 ¿Qué ofrecemos?


Accom es una empresa de carácter joven y competitivo en constante crecimiento. Cuidamos mucho nuestra política de Talento y Cultura, buscando siempre la máxima vinculación de las personas con la empresa. Simplemente tratamos a las personas como nos gustaría que nos tratasen.


  • 📈 Participación en la toma de decisiones.
  • 📅 Horario de inicio flexible (entre 8:30 – 9:30).
  • 💻 Posibilidad de teletrabajo en formato híbrido.
  • 💳 Retribución flexible (seguro médico privado, restaurante, transporte y guardería).
  • 📚 Plan formativo acorde a tus necesidades.
  • 💼 Cursos de idiomas ajustados a tu nivel.
  • 🍰 El día de tu cumpleaños libre.
  • 🤼 Eventos y actividades internas para hacer team building.
  • 🏋🏻‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios.
  • 📍 Ubicaciones céntricas en Madrid (Gran vía, Callao).


¡Si crees que eres el perfil que buscamos, estaremos encantados de conocerte!

Title: Analista de datos (híbrido)
Description:
En Métrica Consulting nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un Analista de datos para la gestión de la configuración y datamining, para incorporar en importante proyecto en sector bancario en modalidad híbrida(Las Rozas) e indefinido.




Necesaria experiencia en:

-Creación de ETLs.

-Gestión del CMDB (sistema de gestión de base de datos).

-Manejo de bases de datos Mysql/Oracle/MariaDB.

-Creación y parametrización de datamodels.

-Conocimiento en programación de APIS Cloud con lenguajes como Python o PHP.




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?

-Contratación indefinida.

-Retribución flexible.

-Teletrabajo.

-Formación en aquellos temas que te resulten interesantes.




Si buscas un proyecto nuevo, y crees que puedes encajar, ¡inscríbete en nuestra oferta, y deja que te conozcamos!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About WOW:

We’re WOW, a ground-breaking concept connecting forward-thinking brands and people at the intersection of online along with offline. We’re here for the crazy ones, the early adopters, the ones who see things differently, seeking to experiment, try new things and open to being surprised. People come to WOW to see and discover what’s new & happening, hence discovering our exclusive and curated brand assortment. In short, WOW is a phygital platform that combines unique physical locations and an online marketplace (WOWconcept.com) as well as partners with Direct to Consumer and established brands to create unique phygital experiences. With a customer centric approach, our goal is to constantly surprise our clients with outstanding customer experiences plus carefully curated brand selection, which can be described as follows: New, Hard to find, Trendy, Exclusive, Desirable and Forward-thinking. Launched in 2020, we started by opening our first physical store in the heart of Madrid. The store is an 8 floor and 5.500 sqm building located at the city center in Gran Via, 18. Now we have made a strategic decision: to stay with the commercial artery of the capital by opening soon our second store, a 9 floor building located at Serrano 52. If there is one thing that was plain to us from the beginning, it was that our success depends on our people and that is why since the start we have worked to define our values, values that are present in everything we do: customer focus, “all for one”, passion and integrity. WOW is a brand-new company, yet full of great, agile, and enthusiastic professionals who drive it as a team in a single direction: to revolutionize retail.




What will you do:

Analyze the performance of Marketing campaigns and conversion rate based on KPIs to evaluate their effectiveness.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track marketing results using visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI or similar.
Monitor and analyze sales trends to identify patterns and new growth opportunities.
Work with the Marketing team to develop strategies based on previously collected data.
Regularly evaluate data analysis tools and processes to ensure they are best suited to the company's current needs.
Interpret large volumes of data, identify trends, detect problems and propose data-driven solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data needs and provide analytical support in different areas of the business.




Who you are

Highly motivated, detail oriented, organized, with strong communication skills, familiar with a team environment.




The experience you bring

Industrial Engineer, Degree in Business Administration, Mathematics or any quantitative field.
At least 3 years of experience in data analysis.
Proficiency in Google Analytics, Google Ads, Power BI.
Knowledge of Tableau, SQL, Looker, Qlik and similar will be an asset. As well as Python, R or other scripting languages.
Experience in retail/ecommerce is an asset.
Fluency in Spanish and English.
Proactive, organized, methodical and able to present data and explain complex concepts easily.




What we offer

All for one, one for all is part of our DNA, therefore, you will have the opportunity to:

Contribute to the growth of a company with a very big ambition at a very early stage.
Join a company where people come first in a young and unbeatable work dynamic, an environment and a great talent where we really live our values.
Permanent contract.
Competitive fixed salary.
Flexible remuneration (Cobee).
Medical insurance.
Other benefits.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
👋 About Us

At The/Studio, our vision is to empower individuals, regardless of their expertise, to unleash their creativity and bring their unique ideas to life through the production of custom products. We are committed to delivering top-quality customized products that not only exceed expectations but also provide a seamless and awe-inspiring experience via our exceptional team and AI-integrated systems. By shouldering the manufacturing burdens, we liberate our customers to focus on their true passions, driving them towards remarkable success and fulfillment. Together, we turn dreams into tangible realities and shape a world where creativity knows no bounds.

Our headquarters are in Los Angeles, California, but we are a truly global company with team-members across the U.S., Europe, South America, Africa, and Asia/Pacific. We have gone to a fully remote working platform so that we can attract the world’s best talent.

All roles at The/Studio are 100% remote from anywhere in the world, as long as you have all your tools and a fast, stable internet connection!

We know that some applicants will not meet all the requirements, so we encourage you to apply anyway so we can determine if something else might be a good fit!




💻 The Role

We are searching for a skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic team! In this role, you will turn data insights into actionable strategies that support our business operations and drive our growth. You will work closely with various teams to collect, analyze, and interpret data to aid in decision-making and improve business performance.

Key Responsibilities as a Data Analyst

Collect, analyze, and interpret large data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.

Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data requirements and provide relevant data solutions.

Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data effectively.

Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular data audits and validations.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.

Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

Stay up-to-date with the latest data analysis tools and techniques to improve processes and deliverables.


What You’ll Achieve in the First Few Months

Within 1 month, understand our data infrastructure and key business metrics, and begin to analyze data and generate reports.

Within 3 months, contribute to major projects and provide insights that inform important business decisions.

By 6 months, become a trusted data advisor for various teams and independently manage data analysis projects.


Required Skills and Qualifications

1+ years of experience in data analysis or a related field.

Experience in a remote, startup environment

Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, or similar.

Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.

Experience with Hubspot CRM.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.

Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure is a plus.



💡 The/Studio’s Company Values

Intellectually curious - possesses a natural disposition and comfort to ask questions, challenge the status quo, and a desire to ‘get to the bottom of things’ if they see something not quite right

Self-motivated with a meaningful reason to deliver excellence

Good communication skills that enhance collaboration, minimize misunderstandings, and at a frequency that is appropriate for a remote team

Radical candor - Coachable, accepting of constructive negative feedback and willing to provide constructive negative feedback where applicable

Operates with a level of urgency - values immediate action where prudent, enables quick decision-making, swift problem-solving, and seizing opportunities in a dynamic business environment

Natural customer centricity - has an affinity to always start their train of thought or analysis with the customer’s perspective, bias towards talking to the customer to understand them

Results-driven - focuses on achieving and exceeding measurable objectives



🔎 Our Typical Hiring Process

Submit an application. IMPORTANT: Please submit your resume/CV in English

Initial Chat with Global Recruiter

Hiring Manager Interview

Assessment/Case Study - if applicable

Final Interview

Note that every role is different, so the process may vary depending on the requirements of the role. Regardless of the result, we always inform candidates via email.

At The/Studio, we know that our Company's strength lies in the diversity of our team. The/Studio is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Our policy is to provide equal opportunities for all applicants and individuals regardless of protected characteristics. We prioritize and maintain a fair, inclusive and equitable workplace free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.




***No third-party recruiters/agencies please

Title: Data Analyst con Power BI - Middle
Description:
Estamos buscando una persona para desarrollar la función de Data Analyst.




Nuestro objetivo es comprender los retos del negocio de nuestros clientes y crear aplicaciones analíticas sólidas y escalables para ayudarlos a mejorar su proceso de análisis y toma de decisiones.




Te unirás a nuestro creciente equipo de analistas y desarrolladores para dar soporte al responsable de la unidad de Negocio, aprendiendo las claves de los procesos de toma de requerimientos, análisis y diseño de nuevas aplicaciones analíticas o del evolutivo de aplicaciones existentes.




También aprenderás las principales técnicas de visualización de datos usando las herramientas más comunes en el sector de Business Intelligence y las mejores prácticas para presentar entregables de calidad a los clientes.




Responsabilidades

Elaboración de Dashboards analíticos (Principalmente con la herramienta PowerBI).
Definición del modelo de datos juntamente con el Data Engineer.
Desarrollo de las métricas y parametrización de los objetos visuales.
Documentación de los informes desarrollados.
Responsabilización de las incidencias y evolutivos relacionados con el proyecto después de su publicación.




Requerimientos:

Experiencia en una posición similar de entre 2 y 3 años.
Conocimiento demostrable con la herramienta de PowerBI.
Experiencia en el desarrollo de proyectos de visualización de datos.
Localización: Barcelona y alrededores. Trabajo remoto, con disponibilidad para acudir puntualmente a la oficina del cliente.
Mentalidad analítica.
Atracción por la resolución de problemas del negocio del cliente.
Trabajo en equipo.
Capacidad para trabajar en un ambiente de trabajo dinámico.
Se valorará formación específica en el procesado de datos y en herramientas BI. En concreto en la herramienta de PowerBI.
Idiomas: excelente español (requerido) y buen dominio del inglés hablado y escrito (valorado).




Ofrecemos:

La posibilidad de aprender y analizar diferentes modelos de negocio (Empresas de servicios IT, comercialización eléctrica, empresas de consumo, empresas del sector agrícola, empresas del sector industrial...).
Formación en herramientas de BI.
Trabajo mayoritariamente en remoto (exceptuando visitas puntuales a cliente).
Contrato indefinido.
Incorporación inmediata y continuidad dentro de la empresa.

Show more

Title: Junior EMEA Regional Data Analyst
Description:
Services_EMEA-E484

Junior EMEA Regional Data Analyst - Full Time - Madrid, Spain

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.

To support the business by maintaining databases, executing and delivering daily reports, designing and/or recommending new tools, training and supporting end-users and maintaining system protocols by writing and updating procedures and documenting tools.

Your main tasks and responsibilities:


To support his/her superior in the analysis and presentation of “Regional Data”
To maintain on daily basis the business data bases ensuring the correctness of the data by performing sanity checks.
To execute and deliver daily reports supporting functional heads to manage their region including maintaining reports documentation.
To participate in the design of new tools by analysing business requirements including writing specifications and documentation of the tools, supporting the development project team by identifying project milestones and establishing and/or monitoring the project progress and Budget
To perform ad-hoc reports and analysis by gathering and analyzing relevant information and evaluating the output requirements and formats.
To recommend controls by identifying data management problems and developing improvement procedures.
To participate in the ERP and tools councils acting as a moderator to the end-users.
To support end-users acting as a trainer and/or consultant providing help desk support.
To keep information confidential.
All other duties as relevant to the post


To succeed in this role, you will need:


Highly numerical and analytical skills.
Highly Excel Skills.
QlikSense or Power BI knowledge.
SQL Knowledge.
BI and / or Data Science experience.
Ideally some operational experience.
Ideally some ERP (SAP and / or D365) experience.
Sound verbal and written English communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group.
Drive for results.
Managing purpose and motivating others.
Ensuring accountability and integrity.
Customer dedication.
Business orientation.
Functional/Technical competency.
Keeping confidentiality


What we offer you:


A competitive salary as well as participation in the variable remuneration system based on personal and financial objectives.
Restaurant tickets.
Permanent contract.
Accident insurance.
Working from home according to local policy.


No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role

Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2024 in Brazil, China, Germany, Switzerland, the United Kingdom and the United States.

Title: Beca Data Analyst
Description:
MADRID


¿Quiénes somos?

Seguro que sabes que podemos llevarte a la playa, a esquiar, a pasar unos días en tu pueblo e incluso de escapada de fin de semana con los amigos. ¿Pero a que no sabes que también somos una empresa con certificación Top Employer y presencia en Francia, Andorra, Portugal, Suiza, Marruecos y Arabía Saudí? ¡Ahora sí!

Multinacional con más de 16.000 personas, nuestro propósito es rediseñar el futuro de la movilidad para que puedas desplazarte de la manera más cómoda, innovadora, eficiente, segura y ecológica posible.

¿Tienes ganas de formar parte de un equipo y crear un impacto con tu trabajo? En Alsa buscamos jóvenes talentos con ganas de aprender y contribuir a la innovación de la marca. Si estás finalizando tus estudios o comenzando tu carrera, esta es la oportunidad que estabas buscando para llenar tu mochila de destrezas y competencias.

Desde la diversidad, la igualdad y el reconocimiento queremos que pases a formar parte de nuestro equipo. ¡Te esperamos!

¿Qué te vas a llevar de este viaje?


Análisis de BBDD relacionales.
Análisis de la calidad del dato.
Configuración de informes y cuadros de mando de visualización de datos.
Diseño de reportes a otras áreas.
Descripción funcional de requerimientos para la automatización de procesos y transferencia de datos.
Realización de queries sencillas con SQL.
Familiarización con herramientas de integración y ETL.
Participación en proyectos de optimización y transformación.


¿Qué te ofrecemos?


Beca con ayuda al estudio por 900€/mes con una duración de 6 meses y la posibilidad de renovar otros 6.
Horario de L a J de 9:00 a 18:00 y los V de 8:00 a 15:00.
Un mentor que te guiará y la oportunidad de aprender de la mano de grandes profesionales del sector que te ayudarán a desarrollar tu máximo potencial.
Oportunidad de participar en nuestros voluntariados.


¿Qué necesitas?


Estudios en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Informática, Ciencia de Datos o similar.
Nivel de inglés medio (B2/C1).
Ser una persona proactiva y colaboradora, con ganas de contribuir al equipo.
Manejo del paquete Office a nivel medio (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
Conocimientos de herramientas de visualización: Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Conocimiento de Python u otros lenguajes de programación (R).
Conocimientos de BBDD SQL.
Conocimiento de Herramientas de ETL y data mining.
¡Muchas, muchas ganas de aprender!


Continúa tu camino con nosotros. ¿Te subes? #hastadondetúquieras #talentoalsa

Title: Data Analyst -Power BI/Azure
Description:
¿Te gustaría seguir desarrollando tu carrera profesional dentro del mundo Data?¿Estás buscando una nueva oportunidad laboral? ¿Cuentas con un background técnico sólido y quieres darle el impulso definitivo a tu carrera? 🚀🚀




VIEWNEXT somos una compañía perteneciente al grupo IBM. Como empresa líder en servicios de Tecnología de la Información, nos encontramos en constante búsqueda de talento entregado al desarrollo y la consultoría en diferentes áreas y tecnologías, obteniendo como resultado un servicio innovador, íntegro, de calidad y adaptado a las necesidades reales de nuestros clientes. Actualmente somos cerca de 5.000 profesionales enfocados en lograr este objetivo.




Estamos en búsqueda de un Data Analyst con experiencia en:

Power BI
Copilot
Azure Cloud

💡 Imprescindible nivel de inglés alto







¿Por qué elegir Viewnext? Te incorporarás a una compañía con:

✔️ Salario competitivo 💸

✔️ Formación en Tecnología y también en 'Soft Skills'

✔️ Acceso a las certificaciones tecnológicas más importantes del mercado. 📚

✔️ Plan de carrera, seguimiento y evaluación anual de tu desarrollo profesional. ⚖

✔️ Plan de retribución flexible (seguro médico, transporte, formación y guardería).

✔️ Tarjeta Restaurante para trabajadores presenciales. 🥗

✔️ Posibilidad de Teletrabajo "Full Remote". 🌐

✔️ Horario de 9.00 a 18.00 con flexibilidad de entrada y salida. ⏳

✔️ Jornada de Verano del 1 Julio al 15 de septiembre. 🌞

✔️ Buen ambiente de trabajo, innovador, abiertos e inclusivos. 💃




Si estás interesad@ no dudes en inscribirte en nuestra oferta para poder contarte más detalles de este proyecto.




¿Quieres conocernos un poco más? Haz click en el siguiente enlace:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C9z50VSdjcs

Title: Consultores Junior Data & Analytics
Description:
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando varios perfiles de Consultor Junior Data & Analytics recién graduados para hacer carrera en nuestra área interna de Delivery en un equipo multidisciplinar de consultores que trabajan por squads dentro de nuestra unidad de negocio de Data & Analytics ubicada en las oficinas de Madrid o Barcelona.




El equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis trabaja con clientes nacionales e internacionales, llevando a cabo importantes proyectos de inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.




FUNCIONES

Te daremos la oportunidad de acceder a varias vías de desarrollo profesional para integrarte dentro de nuestros squads especializados por áreas dentro de nuestra BU de Data & Analytics:

Ingeniería del Dato.
Análisis del Dato.
Ciencia del Dato.
Gobierno del Dato.
Administración de herramientas Data Platform.




REQUISITOS

Que seas recién Titulado/a en Grado Universitario en Ingeniería Informática, Estadística, Data, Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas.
También valorables personas que dispongan de Máster orientado a Big Data, Data Science, Inteligencia Artificial.
Valorable conocimientos en tecnologías de programación tales como R o Python y BBDD SQL y NoSQL.
Buena capacidad analítica, de comunicación y habilidades interpersonales.
Buena actitud, proactividad, ganas de aprender y de tener un gran desarrollo profesional con nosotros.




BENEFICIOS

> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.

> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.

> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto con flexibilidad para ir puntualmente a nuestras oficinas.

> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.

> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).

> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.

> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).

> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.

> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.




¿Te unes a nosotros?

Title: Analista de Datos - Power BI Lead
Description:
Somos un grupo global del Ibex 35 donde desarrollamos proyectos de concesiones, ingeniería y servicios, innovadores de alto valor, en los más de 15 países donde estamos presentes.

Buscamos una persona como tú, que se sume a nuestro #RumboSacyr y nos ayude a seguir mejorando la vida de las personas.

Funciones y responsabilidades del puesto:


Proporcionar apoyo técnico y liderazgo en el uso efectivo de la plataforma Power BI dentro de la organización.
Garantizar que las soluciones de inteligencia empresarial desarrolladas con Power BI cumplan con los más altos estándares de calidad y satisfagan plenamente las necesidades de los usuarios.
Dirigir tanto la implementación inicial como el mantenimiento continuo de las soluciones de datos mediante el uso de Power BI, asegurando la excelencia técnica y la integridad de los datos en todo momento.
Colaborar con los equipos, brindando soporte en el desarrollo de software para comprender los requisitos de usuarios y proyectos, y transformarlos en soluciones técnicas efectivas utilizando Power BI.
Responsable de la creación y diseño de informes dinámicos, paneles interactivos y cuadros de mando en Power BI, con el objetivo de ofrecer análisis detallados que impulsen decisiones concretas.
Estar actualizado sobre las mejores prácticas y de Power BI, con el fin de optimizar el valor y la eficacia de las soluciones implementadas, asegurando que estén siempre alineadas con los estándares más actualizados y eficientes.
Proporcionar asistencia en el uso de Power BI, asegurando una adopción exitosa y aprovechando al máximo sus capacidades.
Identificar y resolver proactivamente problemas técnicos asociados con Power BI, garantizando la estabilidad y el rendimiento óptimo de las soluciones implementadas.


Buscamos un perfil con los siguientes requisitos y competencias:


Licenciatura/Máster en carreras técnicas (Ciencias o Ingenierías), Otras carreras con formación en matemáticas/estadística.
Se valorará Máster en Big Data, Data Analytics.
Trayectoria demostrable de 4-5 años en el área de datos.
Dominio de herramientas para el análisis y la explotación de datos (SQL o similares, QlikView, RStudio, Python).
Conocimientos en herramientas de Business Intelligence y Data Discovery, principalmente PowerBI.
Conocimientos de frameworks de gobierno del dato, como DAMA.
Modelado de datos para DWH y Data Lakes, incluyendo etapas de integración de datos y explotación analítica.
Certificaciones profesionales y postgrados relacionados serán valorados positivamente.


¿Qué te ofrecemos?:


Beneficios sociales (seguro médico, tickets restaurante, cheques guardería), políticas de conciliación, retribución flexible, diversidad y reconocimiento.
Desarrollo personal y laboral a través de programas de formación continua, oportunidades de movilidad interna e internacional, voluntariado y hábitos de vida saludable.
Formar parte de un entorno de trabajo dinámico donde nos guiamos por 3 coordenadas: la inteligencia colaborativa, la excelencia y la responsabilidad social integral.


Para nosotros, el camino es tan importante como la meta, por eso, aprendemos cada día de la riqueza que ofrece la diversidad de personas que formamos parte de este gran equipo.

Nos aventuramos a innovar, a vivir experiencias, a estar unidos y a apostar por tu talento, siempre en la mejor compañía y con nuestra actitud de superación. Juntos somos más fuertes.

Pon rumbo a tu futuro, pon #RumboSacyr.

Title: Técnico/a de Atención al Estudiante y Analista de Datos
Description:
Desde Grupo Planeta nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un/a Técnico/a de Atención al Estudiante y Analista de Datos para nuestra UNIE Universidad, perteneciente a Planeta Formación y Universidades.

¿Cuál sería tu día a día?


Responder eficazmente a los estudiantes en el mínimo de tiempo posible.
Ofrecer al estudiante todas las facilidades de contacto e información necesaria.
Realizar acompañamiento proactivo.
Contribuir a la mejora de las titulaciones asignadas.
Ofrecer calidad en la atención y vocación de servicio.
Adelantarse a las necesidades del estudiante superando sus expectativas.
Participación en acciones y/o proyectos que tengan impacto en la experiencia del estudiante.
Colaboración con otros departamentos implementando procesos de mejora.
Velar por el cumplimiento de los requisitos establecidos en el sistema de gestión de calidad e impulsar la mejora continua del mismo.
Fomentar el acompañamiento personalizado del orientador frente a la diversidad de los estudiantes.



Requisitos:

¿Qué nos gustaría ver en tu CV?


Experiencia en procesos onboarding, atención de consultas, acompañamiento en el Student Journey.
Aptitud de comunicación y organización de eventos con estudiantes
Manejo de herramientas Microsoft, Blackboard y CRM.
Importante dominio de Power BI.



Encajarías con nosotxrs si te consideras una persona con:


Capacidad de escucha y de diálogo y enfocado a resolución de conflictos.
Orientación a la atención de cliente, con habilidades de comunicación y de resolución de conflictos.
Capacidad de toma de decisiones con el fin de proponer cambios o mejoras que impacten en la experiencia.
Buena organización para la ejecución y documentación de los procesos y su seguimiento y evaluación.



¿Qué ofrecemos?


Contrato estable: Indefinido y a jornada completa.
Podrás desarrollarte profesionalmente gracias a nuestros planes de formación y desarrollo de talento interno.
Descuentos y promociones exclusivas para nuestros empleados (masters y posgrados, sellos editoriales, coleccionables, Casa del Libro…).
Un atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales a través del plan de retribución flexible que incluye: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería, seguro médico, etc.

Title: Data Analyst - Retail Media
Description:
En Auren Personas trabajamos desde la división de Selección & Executive Search y nos dedicamos a proporcionar servicios especializados de consultoría de Recursos Humanos.




Actualmente estamos colaborando con una destacada empresa del sector retail ubicada en Madrid, que busca incorporar a su plantilla a una persona para el puesto de Retail Media Data Analyst.




Acerca del Rol




El objetivo del equipo es la comercialización de productos de publicidad digital de alto valor a las marcas en los canales Web, APP y Redes Sociales, así como la prestación de servicios de consultoría y detección de insights basado en el uso de la data transaccional y utilizando herramientas digitales de última generación. El rol de Sr Data Analyst desempeña un papel crucial en diseñar soluciones (reportes e informes).







Funciones:




Análisis y tratamiento de las fuentes de información disponibles
Diseño y construcción del modelo de datos
Definición y construcción de audiencias avanzadas para activación de medios.
Soporte en la creación d nuevos contenidos para la mejora de audiencias y producto
Diseño y desarrollo de cuadros, reportes específicos, de performance y de posicionamiento/insights.




Requisitos:




Entre 4-5 años de experiencia en un rol similar de análisis de datos.
Grado en Matemáticas, Ingeniería, Estadística o similar.
Conocimiento en Herramientas de visualización de datos: PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, entre otros.
Otros conocimientos valorables con herramientas de data (CDP, DMP).
Habilidad para interpretar datos complejos y extraer insights significativos.
Nivel medio-alto de inglés.




Beneficios:




Híbrido en Madrid.
Horario flexible.
Seguro de Vida.
Retribución flexible (ticket restaurante, ticket transporte, ticket guardería, entre otros).




Agradecemos tu aplicación e interés. ¡Esperamos conocer tu talento!




En Auren Selección & Executive Search, ofrecemos un abanico global de soluciones de identificación, captación, selección y evaluación de talento.




Brindamos servicios locales e internacionales para cualquier volumen. Contamos con equipos altamente especializados, más de 20 años de experiencia y probados casos de éxito.

Title: Data Analyst, Finance & Strategy
Description:
About Gelato

Gelato has built the world's largest and most global network for on-demand production of customized items e.g. t-shirts, wall art, mugs, books, hoodies, and cards. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs to sell their creativity globally, with a more local and sustainable production. With local production and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste, and carbon emissions are reduced.

We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities all across the world. We have more than 130 production partners in 32 countries. In 72 hours we can reach more than 5 billion people with customized products in a smarter, faster, and greener way.

Gelato is changing the way that customized products can be produced on-demand. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses. With local production, and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste and carbon emissions are reduced.

Gelato consists of three different business units:

Optimalprint - our B2C e-commerce business, offering beautiful high-quality personalized products to consumers all over the world. The products are produced on-demand by Gelato’s local production network.

GelatoCreate - giving creators across the world instant access to a global market of customers. Simple integrations to webshops such as Shopify, Etsy and TikTok allow creators to connect and personalize their designs for a wide range of quality products, and Gelato takes care of the production and fulfillment through our local production.

GelatoConnect - the backbone of Gelato is enterprise software that powers the world's most advanced production on demand facilities, providing unmatched production workflow, logistics and procurement efficiency, quality management and cost savings.




What we are looking for

We are seeking analytics professionals with a passion for business impact to join our world class Finance & Strategy team. As a Data Analyst, you will help build strategic reports for investor and leadership teams and carry out analysis that will inform important financial and strategic decisions for Gelato. You will guide the finance team using data and insights by not simply presenting data, but telling data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your finance and strategy team members using clear insights and recommendations.

The position is based in Gelato’s offices in London (UK), Oslo (Norway), Stockholm (Sweden), and Madrid (Spain)

What you will be doing

Own the design, development, and maintenance of metrics, reports and dashboards to drive key business performance visibility for finance and strategy teams.
Identify trends & patterns using internal and external data sources powered with analytic models to provide actionable insights to business decision-makers.
Generate forecasts, recommendations, and strategic/tactical plans necessary to drive and influence business decision-making.
Share your knowledge and build creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices.

Who you are

4 years+ of data analytics experience.
Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and integrity in all your analyses
Good time management. You can handle multiple tasks, meeting deadlines without compromising quality.
Collaborative. You work well in a team environment, collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong project and stakeholder management skills. You keep all stakeholders informed and manage expectations effectively.
Extensive hands-on experience in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and BI tools like Looker/Tableau/PowerBI.
Good knowledge of statistical analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with finance data or in finance related roles.
Advanced experience with Looker.
Experience in management consulting would be a plus.

What we offer

We offer you a chance to be part of a truly amazing journey in a company that sets very high targets and works hard to achieve them. You will be able to work with smart, motivated, and engaged co-workers from all over the world, in an intense and very energetic environment. This leads to you having a tangible impact on the way that we operate and expand our business.

Some of the highlights of the package include:

Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvement
Chance to become a shareholder of Gelato!
Flexible festive holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Work at one of our hub city offices or even remotely
And much much more!

What it’s like to work at Gelato

We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.

At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.

Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in English, regardless of which country you are applying from.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Forecast Store Demos And Security Elements For Product Launches

Develop models based on current merchandising to forecast demand at SKU-level based on global strategy, against a fluctuating baseline

Contribute To Marketing Strategy

Be resourceful using sales and merchandising datasets, along with tools to research and develop insights that contribute to strategy decisions

Tell Stories With Data Every Day

Propose and defend your ideas with strong research and compelling analyses to internal cross-functional team and sales/marketing leadership stakeholders

NPI Project Management

Lead projects across internal planning, merchandising, supply/demand and country/regional teams to ensure forecast accuracy and supply availability within a defined schedule

A Mix Of Team & Independent Work

Manage your deliverables and deadlines independently, but connect everything to the bigger picture with your colleagues; communicate the status and results of your independent projects to cross-functional forums

Hard Skills

Very strong Excel and data management; Data visualizations (Tableau/Power BI), analysis and reporting across several levels of the organization; MacOS and iOS; Experience with supply/demand planning, inventory management or retail merchandising an asset

Soft Skills

Detail-oriented; Comfortable working in an extremely agile, collaborative, fast-paced environment with a lot of ambiguity; comfortable working with highly sensitive information; resourceful; deadline-driven; strong problem solving; ability to prioritize multiple, conflicting deliverables; Ideal candidates would have a passion for data storytelling, problem solving, and an interest in collaborating with others to shape the in-store experience for a major tech brand

Education

Bachelor’s degree or data analysis certifications preferred. MBA or master’s in data science a plus.

As an equal opportunity employer, ICONMA provides an employment environment that supports and encourages the abilities of all persons without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or express, ethnicity, national origin, age, disability status, political affiliation, genetics, marital status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Compensation Range:

$40.00 per hour

Welcome to IntePros, a certified woman-owned company specializing in innovative and results-oriented recruiting and staffing solutions. We take immense pride in genuinely understanding what drives and inspires exceptional individuals like you. Your success is our priority, and we are dedicated to actively shaping your long-term career journey. At IntePros, we believe in comprehensive well-being. You have access to our medical, dental, vision, and mental health programs, ensuring your health and wellness are taken care of. To support your continuous growth, we also provide a $1,500 per year education and professional certification fund. Diversity and inclusion are cornerstones of our company ethos. IntePros is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age, veteran or military status, retaliation, or any other characteristic protected by law. We celebrate the rich tapestry of backgrounds and perspectives that make us stronger as a team. Please note that only qualified individuals being considered will be contacted. We appreciate your interest and look forward to potentially embarking on a transformative journey together.

IntePros is excited to partner with a Fortune 200 Investment Banking and Financial Company in helping them identify a Data Analyst for a critical engagement in Lake Mary, FL.


The Data Analyst will support the Data Governance team support team to identify and execute the process and procedures to run Governance Forums and engagement efforts as needed.
This includes working with all lines of business and functions as well as senior level executives.
The incumbent will be responsible for supporting the governance forums, production of content, and develop and communicate messages across stakeholders.
This person will maintain and load content for SharePoint website and online portals and support team department communications to LOB and functions.
Must be dependable and reliable.



Data Analyst role & qualifications:


Stakeholder engagement bi-weekly meetings with data leaders/data officers sharing content
Universal metrics master change control board inventory in Callibra
Leveraging Jira for POM model SharePoint page
Jira, SharePoint, Confluence, Excel, Outlook
Developing and maintaining content

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
About Gen:

Gen is a global company powering Digital Freedom through consumer brands including Norton, Avast, LifeLock, Avira, AVG, ReputationDefender, and CCleaner. Our combined heritage is rooted in providing safety for the first digital generations. We bring leading technology solutions in cybersecurity, privacy and identity protection to more than 500 million users in 150 countries so they can live their digital lives safely, privately, and confidently today and for generations to come. We're always looking for smart, fearless, and dedicated people. Together, we have collective passion and a big vision to power Digital Freedom by protecting consumers and giving them control of their digital lives.

When you’re a part of Gen, you are provided access to a range of resources and support to ensure you can do your best work and live your best life. This includes flexible working options with generous time off and competitive benefits & compensation packages.

Diversity is foundational to how we do business because we know the greatest ideas and results come from our unique perspectives and differences. We strive to create a safe, inclusive environment where you can bring your whole self to work. Team members are valued, respected, and celebrated for who they are in a meaningful and exciting atmosphere. Gen is an equal employment opportunity employer. Employment decisions are based on merit, experience, and business needs.

If this sounds like you—Gen has a dynamic, supportive culture with core values that celebrate diversity, promote teamwork, and encourage every team member to contribute and grow—join us!

HYBRID ROLE: 3x/week in the Tempe, AZ office

About the Role:

For our Analytics and Data Science team in Tempe, Arizona we are currently looking for a Sr Data Analyst.

 

The Sr Data Analyst role will serve as an embedded business intelligence resource for the broader Consumer Sales & Product team, using a broad set of analytical tools to drive insights based on transactional, customer and product data.

The ideal candidate will be highly analytical and numbers oriented, sales driven yet with a strong sense for what constitutes a good customer experience. He/she will also be a strong communicator, knowing how to both convey key insights and garner stakeholder buy-in. A pro-active approach and a strong sense of commitment and ownership are a must. A natural sense of curiosity is a distinct plus.

We expect the successful candidate to have a degree in a quantitative field from a leading university and at least 5 years of experience in a relevant position. Fluent English is required.

Responsibilities:


Transform raw data into useful and actionable insights to help with business decisions
Analyze customer data to identify key trends
Focus on country differences and anomalies
Understand customer experience and product flows
Optimize user conversion and retention
Help with preparation and execution of A/B tests
Work with other data experts (engineering, BI) to ensure data quality is good, as well as enhancements to the data
Ad-hoc analyses
Stakeholder management
Collaborate with data scientists, business analysts, and other teams to solve complex problems
Create clear and compelling data visualizations



Requirements:


Have a passion for data and analytics
Experience of SQL
Good (ideally advanced) Excel skills
Any experience of R or Python would be advantageous, although not essential
Looker and Power BI skills
Strong analytical skills/thinking
Fluent in English



 

Gen is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and accessible environment for all employees. All employment decisions are based on merit, experience, and business needs, without regard to race, color, national origin, age, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth or related medical conditions), genetic information, disability (physical or mental), medical condition, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, military or veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local law. Gen strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based on such protected characteristics and seeks to recruit the most talented candidates from diverse cultures and backgrounds.

We also consider employment-qualified individuals with arrest and conviction records. In addition, we will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Learn more about pay transparency.

Gen complies with all anti-discrimination laws.

To conform to U.S. export control regulations, applicant should be eligible for any required authorizations from the U.S. Government.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview:

We are currently seeking a Junior to Mid-level Data Analyst for a leading company in secure identity product space. This role presents an exciting opportunity to leverage your expertise in data analytics and visualization to drive impactful business decisions.




Required Skills:

Experience: 1-6 years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Tableau Proficiency: Proven ability to develop impactful dashboards and reports using Tableau Desktop or Tableau Server.
SQL and Oracle: Strong command of SQL for querying and manipulating data within Oracle databases.
Analytical Skills: Demonstrated capability in analyzing complex datasets to derive actionable insights.
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving aptitude, coupled with meticulous attention to detail.




Nice to Have:

Alteryx Experience: Familiarity with Alteryx for data blending, preparation, and automation.
Scripting Languages: Basic proficiency in Python or R for data manipulation and automation tasks.
Statistical Analysis: Understanding of statistical methods and their application in data analysis.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse teams.




Responsibilities:

Data Collection and Preparation:
Efficiently gather and clean data from diverse sources, including Oracle databases and internal systems.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through meticulous validation and transformation processes.
Data Analysis and Visualization:
Utilize Tableau to craft visually compelling dashboards and reports that elucidate key trends and insights.
Conduct thorough data analyses to support strategic initiatives and operational improvements.
Reporting and Communication:
Generate routine reports and custom analyses tailored to stakeholder needs.
Present findings and recommendations clearly and concisely to diverse audiences.
Process Enhancement:
Collaborate cross-functionally to streamline data workflows and enhance data quality.
Identify automation opportunities using Alteryx (desirable).




If you are a dedicated Data Analyst with 2-6 years of experience, eager to contribute to cutting-edge initiatives in secure identity products, we encourage you to apply today. Join us in making a difference through data-driven insights!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst

Location: Remote

Duration: 12 months + extensions

Compensation: $30-$45

Work Requirements: US Citizen, GC Holders or Authorized to Work in the U.S.

Skillset / Experience:

Data Analyst

As a Data Analyst, you will coordinate changes to computer databases, test, and implement database management systems. You will ensure the security of computer databases, support product testing, and provide data governance and analysis.

Job Responsibilities:

Verbal and written communication, problem-solving, customer service, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.
Leadership and mentoring skills.
Strong knowledge of database management software.
Review and approve the testing of programs or databases.
Review existing databases and direct changes.
Coordinate database development and determine project scope.
Estimate time and cost for project requests.
Plan and supervise the installation and testing of new products.
Implement security measures to safeguard information.
Develop standards and guidelines for software use and information protection.

Skills:

Power calculations for split studies and lift studies.
Query creation and export for recruited test execution.
Data clean up and governance, PII expertise.
Supporting and connecting findings to business impact.
Tracking product adoption and CPA reduction.
Ongoing metrics reporting.
Cross-functional collaboration and consultation.
Exploring process automation with tools like Metamate and MetaAI.

Education/Experience:

Associate's degree in computer programming or equivalent training required.

Our benefits package includes:

Comprehensive medical benefits
Competitive pay
401(k) retirement plan
...and much more!

Title: Data Analyst I/II
Description:
EQT is the United States largest producer of natural gas with a goal to reach Net Zero by or before 2025 (among the fastest in the industry).

From the office to the field, the #EQTeam is fueling the future. Power your potential with us.

At EQT, we are making strides toward becoming the best producer by creating long-term value for all stakeholders, including employees, landowners, communities, industry partners, and investors. Our vision is to evolve EQT into a modern, connected, digitally enabled organization.

With an incredibly collaborative culture and a determined, progressive workplace, EQT was both named a National Top Workplace, as well as one of Pittsburgh’s Best Places to Work!

Join our Qrew!

The Data Analyst I/II will have a business-facing role in which you will deliver actionable data in tables, reports, and visual forms to the business in order to make more data-driven decisions.

The Data Analyst I/II responsibilities include but are not limited to:

·       Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and provide data-driven solutions.

·       Create visualizations and reports using Analytic tools like Power BI, Spotfire, tableau…

·       Assist in the development of data models and datasets.

·       Support project management efforts by providing accurate and timely data analysis.

Preferred Experience and Skills:

·       Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.

·       Database Skills. ex: SQL, Oracle, Databricks

·       Knowledge of Analysis and AI tools such as Power BI, Spotfire, Excel, R, Python, ChatGPT, Copilot               

·       Ability to effectively communicate complex ideas and findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

·       Strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.

·       Multitasking and interpersonal skills

·       Ability to learn oil & gas operations.

Required Experience and Skills:

·       Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent Experience / Certifications

Must be authorized to work in the US

Remote work is approved for this role, excluding the following states:  Michigan, Illinois, Indiana, Tennessee, Louisiana, New Jersey, and New York, unless willing to relocate.

EQT Corporation and its subsidiaries is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Disabilities/Veterans

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Delphi-US, LLC - Peacemakers in the Talent War
Description:
Title: Data Analyst/Operations Associate (Contract) - Job#5067




Location: Boston, MA




Job Description:

Our client located in Boston, MA has an immediate opening for a Data Analyst/ Operations Associate to join their team. This resource will have data management systems experience, a command of Excel, and intellectual curiosity. This position requires an individual who is exceedingly detail-oriented and organized who possesses a determination for accuracy and has the ability to navigate complex databases.




Responsibilities

Maintain the integrity of the Raiser’s Edge/NXT database specifically for Opportunities, Actions, and Notes with some monitoring of InfoEd.
Monitor the LOI, Planned, Pending, Awarded, Declined, and Withdrawn Gift and Grant Opportunity records within the Raiser’s Edge/NXT and InfoEd databases for FR and CP teams.
Review all opportunities submitted by officers to ensure accuracy.
Retrieve and document notices of grant agreements and grant contracts; upload to corresponding Opportunity record in NXT database.
Enter, review, monitor, and assess Action records weekly in order to ensure timely response to foundation deadlines and reporting: Send related reminders to FR and CP team members; track past due and upcoming gift/grant reports, distribute to FR and CP team, and update NXT as appropriate.
Working with Prospect Development and Research Team, create pending future Action records for foundations determined viable through prospecting.
Reconcile NXT Opportunity and Gift records with projections on a monthly basis to ensure accuracy of each Pending, Awarded, Declined gift/grant submission.
Actively identify and pursue opportunities to improve FR and CP operations by troubleshooting, resolving issues, and leading data cleanup projects.
Manage, coordinate, and maintain the integrity of filing systems; ensure proposal attachments and other frequently needed data are current, e.g. patient demographics, audited financials, board lists, letters of recommendation, etc.
Anticipate and provide timely response to FR, CP, Operations, and Development requests for information, service, and assistance.
Use Asana gift forms to enter upcoming gifts and grants into NXT record.
Schedule and track payments, future payments, create invoices, pledge reminders, draft acknowledgements, and other stewardship activity and outlined in gift/grant agreements and MOUs.




Required

Bachelor’s degree required
Two years of experience focused on data analytics, process implementation and improvements in a nonprofit or for-profit field
Knowledge of fundraising procedures and processes is preferred
Demonstrated ability to take complex data outputs and synthesize into understandable reports
Familiarity with CRM and CRM-related applications and database operations, preferably with those used in development. Experience with Raiser's Edge, Raiser's Edge NXT, and/or InfoEd preferred
Mastery of Excel, the creation and utilization of pivot tables
Proficient with PowerPoint or the equivalent software
Ability to manage multiple tasks in a deadline-driven environment
Proven track record with attention to detail, precision, multi-tasking, and problem-solving
Strong written communications skills
Superior interpersonal, communication and customer service skills
Discretion in handling sensitive and confidential information




About Delphi-US

Delphi-US is a national recruiting firm based in Newport, Rhode Island. We specialize in IT, Engineering and Professional Staffing services for premier corporations and a multitude of industries across the United States. We are the Peacemakers In The Talent War – bringing the best and brightest talent to Employers of Choice, enabling critical project success, fostering progressive employment relationships, and promoting competitive advantages for our Clients and the Talent Marketplace we serve. Delphi accomplishes this with a proprietary skill-based and cultural matching process that results in higher qualified submissions along with increased interviews and offer rates. You’ll find our team is highly experienced, friendly, professional and ready to advocate on your behalf, armed with industry trends, and an understanding of employer expectations.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




The successful candidate will work closely with divisions across our organization and the group to provide actionable insights and make data-driven decisions.

Responsibilities and Duties:

Collaborate with key stakeholders across divisions, ETO, and the group to capture business requirements and translate them into technical needs.
Develop, implement, and maintain databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques, providing ongoing reports.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and clean data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Maintain data security and confidentiality in all tasks.
Communicate effectively with various stakeholders at different levels within the organization, presenting findings and making recommendations.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field.
Have a deep understanding of systems and data architecture, design, and integrations.
Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL, etc.), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks), and reporting packages (Business Objects, Power BI, etc.).
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Our Team as a Data Analyst!

Company: Zenex Partners, Esteem Travel Client

Location: Seattle, WA, USA

Job Title: Data Analyst

Pay Rate : $43/hr W2

Overview: Are you a skilled Data Analyst with a passion for solving complex problems and ensuring compliance through meticulous data management? Zenex Partners, Esteem Travel Client, is seeking a talented individual to join our team in Seattle. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on global compliance reporting initiatives, leveraging your technical expertise and attention to detail.

Key Responsibilities:

Extract, load, and transform data from multiple sources for global compliance reporting.
Validate and verify data attributes using third-party tools, internal systems, and web links.
Investigate data quality issues to ensure consistency and accuracy, proposing and implementing resolutions.
Participate in testing various test cases to meet reporting requirements across different jurisdictions.

Required Technical Skills:

Proficiency in SQL, Tableau, and Excel (e.g., vlookups, sumifs, pivots).
Understanding of common reporting and file transfer technologies.
Experience with Power BI is a plus.
Familiarity with various data analytic tools.

Team Culture: Join a collaborative team focused on creating strategic data sharing reports for government authorities globally. You'll work closely with Product teams to define and execute data collection launches, ensuring compliance with jurisdictional requirements.

Candidate Requirements: To be considered, candidates must complete the Glider assessment (ID: 39371587) and score a minimum of 80%. We seek individuals who thrive in fast-paced environments, excel at problem-solving, and are comfortable working with inconsistent data sets.

Industry Specific Experience: Experience in the platform or gig economy, two-sided marketplaces, or compliance reporting will set you apart.

Interview Process: Candidates will undergo interviews via Zoom, focusing on technical skills, problem-solving abilities, and cultural fit.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
PURPOSE:

The programmer analyst positions primary responsibilities will focus on process improvement, query, and report development along with support duties of multiple IT functions. In addition to supporting a variety of process improvement activities, the Analyst will also support change management efforts to ensure solution implementation and achievement of projected business results. Key support elements of the position will focus on our loan originations system, servicing system, PowerBI reporting platform and corporate data warehouse. The role will report to the Director of IT and will be a key contributor primarily supporting the reporting and analytics group.




We are looking for a candidate that can provide relevant insights to leadership by identifying opportunities & challenges, leveraging information related to all facets of the business process. The ideal candidate will have a problem-solving mindset ready to tackle day-to-day issues across multiple support functions including reporting, query, and data quality resolution. change management efforts to ensure solution implementation and achievement of projected business results.




The role bridges the gap between IT and the Business groups, a unique opportunity to use both technical and analytical skills to improve upon current systems with underlying knowledge of the finance business.




POSITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

•Reviews and identifies opportunities for query and report optimization.

•Develops the business case for change and looks for improvement through automation.

•Report development within our reporting platform.

•Drive changes that will impact multiple functional or business areas.

•Transform strategies into tactical plans to address issues/risks.

•Setting metrics and goals to ensure sustainment of tactics.

•Responsible for technical support of non-complex systems and procedures in a business unit.

•Manage the ticket system for support on the company data warehouse.

•Diagnoses and resolves user problems.

•Creates, develops, and manages procedural documentation.

•Develop and execute test plans.




QUALIFICATIONS:

•Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis in Computer Science/Information systems or 5 years equivalent relevant work experience.

•On-hands experience with PowerBI dataset management and report development.

•Previous banking or financing experience.

•Experience with SQL, Python, VBA, C#, or other scripting language.

•Strong problem-solving and partnership skills.

•Strong experience in research, problem determination, and issue resolution.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ignite Your Career at Apex - Where Passion Drives Purpose!




Join a team that goes beyond the ordinary at Apex. We're not just hiring; we're searching for passionate, motivated, and knowledgeable leaders eager to make a significant impact with a dynamic and growing team. At Apex, innovation and collaboration come together at the forefront of environmental excellence. Let’s redefine the possible, together.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our headquarters in Rockville, Maryland. In this critical role, you'll take ownership of the management, analysis, and implementation of data to inform decisions and craft tailored business strategies that drive our company’s initiatives forward.




Compensation: This position earns a competitive salary range of $100,000 - $135,000 per year based on the candidate's qualifications and experience.




Remote Flexibility: Enjoy the benefits of working remotely while supporting a dynamic team.




If you're eager to advance your skills and lead the charge in a data-driven environment, this is the perfect opportunity to showcase your expertise!




What You'll Do:




Design and Implementation

Develop engaging dashboards/datasets and create intuitive dashboard filters and beast mode calculations.
Modify datasets for privacy compliance.




Data Maintenance and Reporting

Resolve issues with filters, parameters, and calculations.
Integrate data from multiple platforms seamlessly while maintaining data integrity and sourcing critical data.
Oversee and manage periodic reporting, ensuring timely and accurate delivery.




Administration

Address Domo user inquiries promptly.
Control dashboard access and Outlook Group memberships.
Design, implement and maintain robust Personal Data Protection policies.
Update employee rosters and handle IT tickets.




Why you'll love working for us:

Company-subsidized medical and dental insurance plans.
Company-paid life, short, and long-term disability.
401k match, tuition assistance, and more.
Cross-training opportunities and the ability to work on a variety of projects while actively tapping into various pathways for promotion and growth.
Work alongside the most creative professionals in the industry at a 900+ employee national firm with 50+ locations across the US.
Positive impact: Join a company that prioritizes environmental responsibility.




What We Need:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.
5 to 10 years of experience in business/finance, business intelligence, and data analytics.
A minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience with Domo.
Expertise in SQL coding and proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI, with a proven mastery in building complex dashboards and advanced calculations.
Deep knowledge of data privacy policies and experience in advanced data maintenance.




Apex Companies, LLC is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.




We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

HTML:
Ignite Your Career at Apex - Where Passion Drives Purpose!


Join a team that goes beyond the ordinary at Apex. We're not just hiring; we're searching for passionate, motivated, and knowledgeable leaders eager to make a significant impact with a dynamic and growing team. At Apex, innovation and collaboration come together at the forefront of environmental excellence. Let’s redefine the possible, together.


We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our headquarters in Rockville, Maryland. In this critical role, you'll take ownership of the management, analysis, and implementation of data to inform decisions and craft tailored business strategies that drive our company’s initiatives forward.


Compensation: This position earns a competitive salary range of $100,000 - $135,000 per year based on the candidate's qualifications and experience.


Remote Flexibility: Enjoy the benefits of working remotely while supporting a dynamic team.


If you're eager to advance your skills and lead the charge in a data-driven environment, this is the perfect opportunity to showcase your expertise!


What You'll Do:


Design and Implementation

  • Develop engaging dashboards/datasets and create intuitive dashboard filters and beast mode calculations.
  • Modify datasets for privacy compliance.


Data Maintenance and Reporting

  • Resolve issues with filters, parameters, and calculations.
  • Integrate data from multiple platforms seamlessly while maintaining data integrity and sourcing critical data.
  • Oversee and manage periodic reporting, ensuring timely and accurate delivery.


Administration

  • Address Domo user inquiries promptly.
  • Control dashboard access and Outlook Group memberships.
  • Design, implement and maintain robust Personal Data Protection policies.
  • Update employee rosters and handle IT tickets.


Why you'll love working for us:

  • Company-subsidized medical and dental insurance plans.
  • Company-paid life, short, and long-term disability.
  • 401k match, tuition assistance, and more.
  • Cross-training opportunities and the ability to work on a variety of projects while actively tapping into various pathways for promotion and growth.
  • Work alongside the most creative professionals in the industry at a 900+ employee national firm with 50+ locations across the US.
  • Positive impact: Join a company that prioritizes environmental responsibility.


What We Need:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.
  • 5 to 10 years of experience in business/finance, business intelligence, and data analytics.
  • A minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience with Domo.
  • Expertise in SQL coding and proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI, with a proven mastery in building complex dashboards and advanced calculations.
  • Deep knowledge of data privacy policies and experience in advanced data maintenance.


Apex Companies, LLC is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT CORDIAL

We founded Cordial in 2014 on the belief that there should be more humanity and empathy in marketing—both in how brands communicate with their customers and in how technology companies work with brands. We built our company and platform purposefully, driven by a desire to inspire more thoughtful communication and to create experiences that feel more personal and human—for consumers, for the people at the companies we work with, and for Cordial employees. Today, brands like PacSun, Revolve, Abercrombie & Fitch, Realtor.com, L.L. Bean and Forbes rely on Cordial to drive revenue growth by sending a better message.

We chose the name Cordial to symbolize how we empower our clients to communicate with their customers, as well as how we do business: with transparency, collaboration, and trust. We're building a passionate team of individuals willing to learn, grow, and be thoughtfully challenged on a daily basis to continuously improve our product, company, and culture every single day.

OUR VALUES


Communicate better than the rest
Tenacious about the client and the problems we solve for them
We're owners and we act like it
Be Cordial


POSITION SUMMARY

We're looking for an experienced, self-driven data enthusiast to shape marketing stories, future strategies and client success. This role demands an analyst with a knack for dissecting large datasets to extract clear, actionable insights. You'll be pivotal in compiling and analyzing client datasets and crafting workbooks to drive optimizations across email, SMS, and in-app push campaigns. Additionally, you'll work to establish and update performance benchmarks and deliver ad hoc reporting based on business needs. The ideal candidate is able to push beyond descriptive analytics into Diagnostic, Predictive and Prescriptive Analytics with ease.

YOU WILL


Analyze historic marketing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive strategic decision-making.
Develop and maintain complex Excel and Google Sheets workbooks to track and report on key marketing KPIs, including open rates, click-through rates, unsubscribe rates and revenue trends.
Investigate and pinpoint the root causes of data anomalies and trends.
Prepare and deliver presentations to communicate insights, recommendations, and performance metrics to internal leaders as well as clients and other internal stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product, and engineering, to develop data-driven analysis and recommendations.
Innovate with our Product and Engineering teams to unlock new manners of getting to the right answer while saving time.


ABOUT YOU


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Marketing)
3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a marketing or digital marketing environment
Familiarity with marketing automation or Email Service Provider platforms
Proficiency in Excel, Google Sheets, Google Analytics, and Tableau
Strong understanding of core marketing analytics KPIs, such as open rates, click-through rates, and unsubscribe rates
Familiarity with statistical experimentation and A/B testing principles
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information in a clear and concise manner
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively


COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

$85,000.00 - $115,000.00 annually. The compensation range may be adjusted based on experience and location. In combination with base salary, Cordial's compensation package includes equity and bonus, a robust benefit plan (medical/dental/vision/life), 401k match, flexible time off. Additionally, we offer perks such as monthly wellness and cell phone stipends, childcare and continued education yearly reimbursements. We pride ourselves in maintaining a healthy work/life balance, a strong dedication to DE&I efforts, and an overall respectful and open culture!

Please note: In the current environment, Cordial employees are working completely remote and our recruitment process will entail both phone and video Zoom interviews. And if hired, your onboarding will be done remotely. Stay safe!

Cordial is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive workplace with equal opportunity for all applicants. Our goal is to recruit the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool regardless of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability status, sex (including pregnancy), age, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Cordial is committed to working with and providing access and reasonable accommodation to applicants with mental and/or physical disabilities. If you require an accommodation, please reach out to your recruiter once you've begun the interview process. All requests for accommodations are treated discreetly and confidentially, as practical and permitted by law.
