Cliente da área de Financial Services, parte do Grupo que contempla entidades de Banca, Seguros e Risco.

Job Description

  • Integrar equipa de Reporting financeiro e Gestão de Dados;
  • Garantir o conhecimento ao nível da gestão de dados dos múltiplos sistemas da empresa;
  • Realizar a extracção de informação integrada nos múltiplos sistemas;
  • Assegurar a extracção dos dados dos sistemas origem, a transformação e representação ao nível de modelos de análise de dados (SQL e Python);
  • Garantir a representação e gestão da informação ao nível da Operational Data Store, Data Warehouse e Datamarts;
  • Assegurar a revisão e validação dos dados recebidos, garantindo a sua qualidade;
  • Utilização de ferramentas workflow de orquestração;
  • Desenvolvimento de dashboards

The Successful Applicant

  • 3 anos de experiência em Busines Intelligence. Analytics, Dados ou equivalente;
  • Experiência profissional com Python e Microsoft SQL Server (mandatório)
  • Licenciatura Pré-Bolonha ou Mestrado Integrado em Sistemas de Informação ou similares;
  • Experiência profissional na implementação de soluções na área de Seguros e/ou Servços;
  • Tecnologias: Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services; Microsoft SQL Server Management; Microsoft Visual Studio; Power BI; SAS Data Integration.

What's on Offer

Diversidade de funções, responsabilidades e crescimento

Progressão de carreira

Acompanhamento multidisciplinar

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Our Business

team.blue is an ecosystem of successful brands working together across regions to provide customers with everything they need to succeed online. 40+ successful brands make up the group; within those brands, over 2000 experts serve its 2.5+ million customers across Europe and beyond. team.blue's brands are a mix of traditional hosting businesses, offering services from domain names, email, shared hosting, e-commerce and server hosting solutions and specialist SaaS providers offering adjacent products such as compliance, marketing tools and team collaboration products. This broad product offering makes it a one-stop partner for online businesses and entrepreneurs across Europe.

The Team

You will join the Data & Analytics team, offering a unique opportunity to become part of the central data unit within one of Europe's most ambitious and rapidly growing hosting companies, serving over 2.5 million customers. As a leader in our industry, we understand the crucial role Data Engineering plays in harnessing customer data to inform and drive our commercial strategy.

What you will bring: You are self-motivated, ambitious, and collaborative, capable of independently turning new ideas into actionable steps. You excel at communicating across all levels of the organization, translating technical jargon into business-friendly language, and converting business requests into technical solutions. This role requires you to meet deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously. The ideal candidate will thrive in this environment and have a proven track record in similar roles.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines to ingest, process, and transform large volumes of structured and unstructured data from various sources.
Implement efficient ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure timely and accurate data delivery to downstream systems and applications.
Design and implement data models and schemas to support analytical and operational requirements, ensuring data integrity, consistency, and efficiency.
Manage and optimize database systems for performance, security, and scalability, including schema design, indexing, and query optimization.
Integrate data from various internal and external sources, including APIs, databases, and third-party systems, to enrich and enhance our data assets.
Understand or quickly learn business concepts in the domains of marketing, finance, PE, M&A and more.



Technical Skills Required


Advanced skills in SQL (TSQL, PgSQL, PLSQL) shell scripting (bash, PowerShell ) and python
Good knowledge of at least one database engine between: Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, MySQL
Experience in ETL/ELT development, frameworks and components ( SSIS, Power Query, Pandas, Airflow, cloud services)
Good knowledge of data warehouse modelling techniques (dimensional model, star schema, snowflake design)
Proficiency in analytical frameworks (Excel, R/Python).
Knowledge of Microsoft Master data and Analysis services
Flexibility to learn and adapt; strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.



Education And Work Experience


At least 3 years of relevant experience, working in business intelligence, ideally in a related industry
Advanced degree in Computer science, STEM subjects (Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Engineering, etc), or relevant work experience
Demonstrable track record in developing data intelligence solutions that are stable and high performing; provide business value; and use resources efficiently



About The Job

As a data engineer, you will develop and maintain the central data warehouse and help us take the most value out of our data and meet our increasing data needs. Your work assignments will centre around back-end development, focusing on building optimized data structures with best-in-class load performance. You will help us integrate newly acquired businesses into the central data warehouse, besides improving and expanding already existing structures to enable an even more data-driven approach. To this extent, your role will be crucial in supporting the Data & Analytics team in increasing the data available centrally and its fast, easy access for the end users. You will play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights that inform business strategies, improve customer processes, and drive overall performance. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem-solving skills, and a passion for uncovering trends and patterns within complex datasets. The central Data & Analytics team is one of the pillars of team.blue strategy, and the priorities and collaboration in the team are aligned daily with full involvement from team members and the management.

Right to work

At any stage please be prepared to provide proof of eligibility to work in the European country you are applying for.

Unfortunately, we are unable to support Sponsorship Visas.

"Come as you are"

Everyone is welcome here. Diversity & Inclusion are at our core. Far above any technical competence, we value respect, openness, and trusted collaboration. We do not tolerate intolerance.

The most trusted digital enabler

team.blue is a leading digital enabler for companies and entrepreneurs. It serves over 3.3 million customers in Europe and has more than 2000 experts to support them. Its goal is to shape technology and to empower businesses with innovative digital services.

Click here to read more about team.blue

Title: Data Driven | Data Engineer
HTML:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

We are currently looking for a Data Engineer to work with us.


Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in IT or equivalent;
  • At least 3 years of experience as a Data Engineer;
  • High level of experience with the following programing languages: Python and SQL;
  • Working experience with AWS or Azure;
  • Proficient Level of English (spoken and written);
  • Good communication skills;
  • Knowledge in Airflow will be a plus.


 


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Número da Solicitação de Emprego: 72083

Horário:

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

All applications must be sent in English.

Your Tasks:



Enable the creation of new Business Intelligence solutions and enhance existing ones in Qlikview, focusing on the technical design and construction of BI models, including Qlikview as well as in Azure Data Factory (ADF), storage and transformation in SQL Database, up to creation of Azure Analysis Services (AAS) layer, Power BI and Qlikview reports.
Design the architecture of BI solutions in alignment with the principles, guidelines and standards from IT Architecture and create Solution Design Documents in the active project
Build up understanding of existing Qlikview architecture and underlying business processes
Analyze existing applications and optimize their performance
Drive and supervise ETL processing
Document and provide technical specifications for the implementations
Refine and promote our agile delivery framework to help ensuring high quality and flexible deliverables on the data & BI platform
Provide consulting to the business partner for solution implementation



Our expectations:



Expert knowledge in Qlikview.
Knowledge of Microsoft’s BI stack, namely Azure SQL Database/Azure Synapse, Azure Analysis Services, ADF, DevOps, expertise in PowerBI would be preferred.
Expert knowledge in Tabular Models development and maintenance.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Sciences
Min.5 years of experiences in BI projects, preferable in Logistics industry
Proficient Level of English (spoken and written)
You feel comfortable in international business communication
You are willing to challenge the status quo and to drive innovation and change



What we offer:



Permanent contract, 35h work per week
Private Medical care
Comprehensive onboarding program
Internal training catalogue and e-learning platform
Co-financed for language learning
Culture of feedback
Internal transition program
Scandinavian work culture
Work-life Harmony



DSV - Transporte Global e Logística

A DSV é um local de trabalho dinâmico que promove a inclusão e a diversidade. Conduzimos os nossos negócios com integridade, respeitando as diferentes culturas, dignidade e os direitos dos indivíduos. Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com mais de 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn , Facebook e Twitter .

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Job Req Number: 72084

Time Type:

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Become part of The Centre of Insights and Analytics (CIA) team that is working with all DSV business divisions as well as Group Functions to simplify information gathering and turning data into insight
Create visually powerful dashboards in Microsoft Power BI that turn data into information
Champion user experience best practices for business stakeholders
Be a business partner for both business divisions/Group Functions as well as IT departments, acting as an interface to bring business intelligence to the next level
Support BI management in the implementation of the Global BI Roadmap
Design, develop, document and maintain business intelligence solutions
Support the advanced analytics team in creating advanced analytics solutions
Work in projects together with the business partners internally
Act as knowledge hub for Microsoft Power BI to empower business partners



Our requirements:



University degree in IT, business studies or any related studies
Minimum 2 years of experience in similar position (Business Intelligence)
Proven expert knowledge of Business Intelligence tools (focus on Microsoft Power BI)
Ability to visualize information in a value adding way
Experience with complex DAX functions and Power Query
Deep knowledge of BI processes and good practices characteristic for a large corporation
Practical SQL scripting knowledge (ideally SQL Server with optimization knowledge)
Azure Data Stack knowledge (Azure Data Factory, Azure Analysis Services, Databricks, Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2), with special focus on Databricks
Knowledge of advanced analytics / data science methodologies and tools (R, python, Pytorch)
Knowledge of data modelling concepts
Basic knowledge of SAP Business Warehouse
Basic knowledge of financial data structures
Fluent English both spoken and written



What we offer:



Permanent contract (with basic salary in 14 installments per year)
Private medical care
English courses - financial or co-financed by company
Food allowance (EUR 8.32, per working day)
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work (3 days in a week at the office)
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Good access to public transports



DSV – Global Transport and Logistics

DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of more than 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.

We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn , Facebook and Twitter .

Job Req Number: 72084

Time Type:

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:


  • Become part of The Centre of Insights and Analytics (CIA) team that is working with all DSV business divisions as well as Group Functions to simplify information gathering and turning data into insight
  • Create visually powerful dashboards in Microsoft Power BI that turn data into information
  • Champion user experience best practices for business stakeholders
  • Be a business partner for both business divisions/Group Functions as well as IT departments, acting as an interface to bring business intelligence to the next level
  • Support BI management in the implementation of the Global BI Roadmap
  • Design, develop, document and maintain business intelligence solutions
  • Support the advanced analytics team in creating advanced analytics solutions
  • Work in projects together with the business partners internally
  • Act as knowledge hub for Microsoft Power BI to empower business partners


Our requirements:


  • University degree in IT, business studies or any related studies
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in similar position (Business Intelligence)
  • Proven expert knowledge of Business Intelligence tools (focus on Microsoft Power BI)
  • Ability to visualize information in a value adding way
  • Experience with complex DAX functions and Power Query
  • Deep knowledge of BI processes and good practices characteristic for a large corporation
  • Practical SQL scripting knowledge (ideally SQL Server with optimization knowledge)
  • Azure Data Stack knowledge (Azure Data Factory, Azure Analysis Services, Databricks, Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2), with special focus on Databricks
  • Knowledge of advanced analytics / data science methodologies and tools (R, python, Pytorch)
  • Knowledge of data modelling concepts
  • Basic knowledge of SAP Business Warehouse
  • Basic knowledge of financial data structures
  • Fluent English both spoken and written


What we offer:


  • Permanent contract (with basic salary in 14 installments per year)
  • Private medical care
  • English courses - financial or co-financed by company
  • Food allowance (EUR 8.32, per working day)
  • Work schedule 35h/week
  • Hybrid and flexible work (3 days in a week at the office)
  • Comprehensive onboarding program
  • Buddy
  • Good access to public transports


DSV – Global Transport and Logistics

DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of more than 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.

We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn , Facebook and Twitter .

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:

As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we’re able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Essential Skills


  • Minimum of 5 years' experience in a similar role;
  • Experience in Data Visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI;
  • Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas);
  • Proficiency in SQL;
  • Fluent English.

Title: Salesforce Developer
HTML:
1GLOBAL - Enterprise and Consumer eSIM and IoT Solutions. Connecting people and devices instantly, anywhere with our unique connectivity solutions. Managing mobile devices and connectivity globally for the world's largest investment banks, enterprises, big tech & IoT businesses. 

1GLOBAL is experiencing stratospheric growth and are looking for committed enterprise sales professionals with a strong entrepreneurial spirit, wishing to accelerate their career through an exciting and challenging role that exposes the right candidates to the cutting edge world of global wireless communication.

1Global isn't just another mobile company - it's a powerhouse in the world of wireless communications. With a network spanning 15 offices across 12 countries, we're the go-to choice for the world's largest investment banks, enterprise, big tech and B2B2C customers. From cutting-edge eSIM solutions to seamless data roaming, and innovative voice and SMS recording services, we're at the forefront of it all.

We are a world-leading innovator by partnering with the worlds largest device manufacturers and digital platform owners we defining the future of connectivity, our growth is nothing short of meteoric.

We're now gearing up to take our brand to even greater heights! 

Position Overview:

You will be part of a team responsible for providing solutions within the Salesforce platform for all lines of business. We seek a driven and intelligent individual with a proven track record in roles that connect product and technology teams within product-led growth companies.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Perform technical analysis, design, development, testing, and support for Salesforce
  • Perform Apex development including interfaces, classes, controllers, and triggers
  • Integrate Salesforce with other internal services or 3rd party systems using web
  • Develop reusable Lightning Web Components;
  • Seek out ways to utilize SFDC to improve business productivity and serve as a subject
  • Advocate for high code quality, readability and high tests coverage;
  • Work with an Agile methodology;
  • Identify areas of improvement in the codebase and promote them through seamless integrations, documenting solutions and new flows;



Requirements

Qualifications:

  • Experience as developer within Salesforce including SOQL/SOSL, jQuery, APEX and Visualforce;
  • Hands on experience in Lightning Components, Process Builders, Flows, Visualforce,
  • Experience integrating Salesforce with 3rd party applications;
  • Experience with development language .NET or Go is a plus;
  • Experience with unit/integration/e2e testing (test driven development is a plus);
  • Proficiency with REST APIs, both in implementing and consuming the interfaces;
  • Familiarity with relational databases, CI/CD flows, Git, Docker, and Kubernetes;
  • Familiarity with development tools and processes (Git-flow, peer reviewing);
  • Good understanding of cloud services and scalable infrastructure;
  • Excellent communication skills (fluent in English, both written and spoken), with a self-motivated and autonomous mindset.



Benefits

Why 1GLOBAL?

Embarking on a journey with 1GLOBAL is an opportunity to be a part of a team that's shaping the future of telecommunications and technology. Your contributions will be valued, your ideas will be heard, and your career will soar to new heights!

 

What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary and the opportunity to reach massive levels of performance driven compensation boosted by accelerators.
  • The opportunity to grow your role within one of the industries' most dynamic and successful telecommunications company that is growing over 40% year-over-year, lead by a duo of very successful technology repeat entrepreneurs.
  • Opportunities to work internationally in one of the other offices of 1GLOBAL.
  • A dynamic and collaborative work environment.
  • The chance to play a decisive role in of a forward-thinking company at the forefront of global communications innovation.

1GLOBAL is an equal opportunity employer, we value your character as much as your talent. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. We are excited for you to join our mission to revolutionise connectivity globally.

Title: Data Engineer, Data Foundation Team (Hybrid)
Description:
Job Req Number: 70859

Time Type:

Data Engineer – Data Foundation Team (Hybrid)

At DSV, we are on a journey to renew the Global Data and Analytics Platform that is being used by colleagues, customers and Business Partners in all Business Domains to get the most information out of available data.

Our department members are placed in numerous locations around Europe, Asia and South Africa.

A significant part of our department is located in Lisbon, grouped in development and operations teams.

For the Data Foundation Team, we are looking for a Data Engineer to support the team of currently 3 team members plus the Manager.

The position is part of the Global organisation and work will be in close collaboration with colleagues across locations in the department.

To achieve our goals, we are working on an ambitioned plan and have chosen a vendor who is offering us a full stack of services. All of our work is done in the cloud, utilising the full stack of Microsoft’s offering: Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Server /Azure SQL Synapse, Azure Analysis Services, DataBricks, PowerBI Services, Azure Data Factory, Azure DevOps.

DSV will also embark on a multi cloud strategy and introduce technologies to facilitate cloud provider agnosticism.

The Data Foundation team works as technology spearheads and supports the delivery and operations teams with tools, frameworks, processes, and coaching. We deliver in an agile way with Jira as our management tool.

As a Data Engineer in Data Foundation Team, your major responsibilities will be:



Manage and optimize cross department tools.
Be a key member in cross data foundation implementation projects.
Analyse existing applications and optimize their performance.
Design and implement solutions that will support the development of our Operational Data Warehouse (ODW) in alignment with IT Architectural principles, guidelines, and standards.
Rapidly build up understanding of existing architecture and underlying business processes
Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines for ingesting, processing, and transforming large volumes of data from various sources.
Analyse requirements together with our different department teams.
Document and provide technical specifications for the implementations.
Refine and promote our agile delivery framework to help ensure high quality and flexible deliverables on the data & BI platform.
Actively transfer knowledge to other team members as well as the Operations & Support team.



Skills & Competencies

To perform the job successfully you should demonstrate the following competencies:



Analytical Skills: Ability for systematic and rational analysis to identify the root cause of problems.
Delivery & Project Management: Experience with Agile methodology, and the ability to promote and facilitate deliveries accordingly.
Conversational Skills: Being comfortable in international business communication, able to communicate openly and confidently, able to listen effectively, able to influence and convince others in a way that results in acceptance and agreement.
Personal Skills: Ability to work with different cultures and to manage cross functional interfaces, high priority for teamwork, capable to build strong and long-term team relationships within and across functions and geographical boundaries and based on ethics and trust, ready to take personal accountability for achieving individual and shared goals.



Required Experience:



Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer sciences, Data Science, Information Technology or a related field.
3-5 years of experiences in BI/Data Engineering projects.



Technical requirements:



Expert knowledge of Microsoft’s Data stack: Azure Datalake, Azure SQL Database/Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Synapse integration, DevOps, etc
Ability to monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines for performance and reliability.
Experience with profiling and tuning queries for efficiency.
Experience in working with GIT repositories.
Experiences of Agile methodology and CI/CD practices.
Experience with task management tools (JIRA, Confluence)
Experience with Databricks and Pyspark/Scala/Spark SQL
Expert Knowledge of data governance principles to ensure data quality, lineage, and compliance.



Languages



Proficient Level of English (spoken and written)



Our offer:



Permanent contract (with basic salary in 14 installments per year)
Private medical care
English courses - financial or co-financed by company
Food allowance (EUR 8.32, per working day)
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work (3 days in a week at the office)
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Good access to public transports



DSV - Transporte Global e Logística

A DSV é um local de trabalho dinâmico que promove a inclusão e a diversidade. Conduzimos os nossos negócios com integridade, respeitando as diferentes culturas, dignidade e os direitos dos indivíduos. Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com mais de 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn , Facebook e Twitter .

Title: Data Engineer (Azure)
Description:
This is a remote position.

Job Description:

We are currently looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer with expertise in Azure to join our team. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for creating, developing, and maintaining our data infrastructure and systems. You will work closely with our data analysts and scientists to ensure that our data is accurate, reliable, and easily accessible.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop, design, and maintain data infrastructure and systems in Azure
Collaborate with data analysts and scientists to ensure data accuracy and reliability
Implement and develop data pipelines
Optimize and manage data storage and retrieval
Troubleshoot and monitor data issues
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering
Work closely with DevOps team to ensure smooth deployment and operation of data systems


Requirements


Strong experience with Azure data services such as Azure Data Factory and Synapse.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Benefits

Salary based on your skills and experience and according to the Software Development market practices.

Food ticket

Private Medical Insurance

B2B contracts may be accepted

Title: APS Oracle/SQL Expert
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €652M. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 18 EMEA countries. Become one of our +8.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

The APS Oracle/SQL Expert Lux APS Team, also known as application DBAs, is an internal Team formed to support Lux applications used by the internal projects of BNP to deploy solutions for their applications to deliver service to internal or external clients of BNP, by delivering expertise in the field of relation database technologies.

This team is also responsible to maintain, guarantee and improve the current service provided by the transversal applications by identifying root causes, suggest and implement improvements on the current processes. The team also following strictly the ITIL practices on their daily activities.

The team is located exclusively in Lisbon, but has close relationship with Infrastructure teams located in Madrid and Paris, which work in proximity and sharing synergies, providing also handover situations for incident, and support management of the applications.


Qualifications


RDBMS Knowledge  (Oracle, SQL Server or Sybase);
Procedural development experience;
Query tuning experience;
OS configuration for database instances (Red Hat Linux).
Fluency in English is mandatory (both written and spoken).


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: SQL Server Developer
HTML:
Finsolutia is a modern, dynamic and robust Fintech, specialized in the credit area, with more than 300 employees at Iberian level.

We have a challenging and ambitious professional project for a SQL Server Associate, with the opportunity to develop technical and personal skills, knowledge and above all grow.

The Profile We’re Looking For

  • Hard skills:
    • Proven 2+ years of experience as an SQL Developer and ETL Processes;
    • Excellent understanding of T-SQL programming, Microsoft SQL Server;
    • Knowledge of data modeling following the best practices;
    • The Software Development Life Cycle (specifically Scrum) and the Agile methodology;
    • Fluent in English.
  • Soft Skills:
    • Proactivity and constant technological evolution;
    • Team work and result oriented;
    • Good communication and interpersonal / facilitation skills.
Nice To Have

  • Experience in ETL processes with SSIS and Console Applications (C#);
  • Effective Experience with SQL Server 2019 and In-Memory;
  • Query Optimization (SPs, Views, Functions, Dynamic Sql, …) using DMVs and advance optimization tools;
  • Knowledge and experience in Data Security and Data Protection.

The Day-to-day Of This Position

  • Develop high-quality SQL Server database solutions;
  • Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements;
  • Writing optimized SQL queries for integration with other applications;
  • Designing database tables and related objects;
  • Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions;
  • Developing scripts and procedures for application development;
  • Implement ETL Processes;
  • Research required data;
  • Suggest new queries.

What We Offer

  • We are Competitive | Attractive remuneration and benefits package;
  • Welcome kit | On your first day you'll have all the material you need to start your journey with us;
  • Your success is ours | You'll have initial (on-job) and ongoing training;
  • We care about you | We offer you health and life insurance, curative medicine and an annual vaccination program;
  • We care about the world | Throughout the year we develop various corporate responsibility activities in which you can participate and even help organize;
  • We are fans of accountability and commitment | We flex work but we hold everyone accountable for the results and work done;
  • We are all different | We provide a benefits platform;
  • We work hard, yet we promote a fun work environment | We have several corporate events that are true moments of sharing and fun;
  • Extra days | Your birthday is meant to be spent with family and friends;
  • They say that the most important meal of the day is breakfast | Have it with us every day at the office;
  • Several discounts and advantages | By being part of our team you'll have access to several discounts and protocols.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
A Snapshot of Your Day

We’re looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join the new business operations team in ED&AA (Enterprise Data and Advanced Analytics). In a typical day you will be meeting colleagues in the business who are seeking solutions to new data challenges, to understand their challenges and devising an appropriate, high-quality architecture for engineers to implement. You will be also communicating with data engineering, AI, data science and data visualization colleagues on live projects, advising and trouble-shooting the implementation.




How You’ll Make An Impact / Responsibilities

Manage the data pipeline, connectivity and data transformation integrating machine learning models to optimize data pipelines to support projects.
Use state of the art technologies to acquire, ingest and transform big datasets, as well as using Python and SQL daily.
Responsible for the infrastructure models to catch data from the source, setting up requirements to extract data from restricted knowledge.
Responsible for the target database system and own data warehousing process.
Map data fields to hypothesis, curate, wrangle and prepare data to be used in advanced analytics models.
Progress work on ETL chains and jobs.
Create and manage data environments in the cloud or on premise.
Ensure information security standards are always maintained.
Contribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and clients.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in data science principle and with state-of-the-art technology to best support the business in making truly data driven decisions




What You Bring / Skills, Capabilities

Knowledge of software engineering concepts and an understanding of best practices.
Experience building data pipelines in production and ability to work across structured, semi-structured and unstructured data, as well as experience preparing data for analytics

and following a data science workflow.

Understand the peer review process and state of the art tech documentation.
Understand issues regarding connectivity, data transformation and be able to integrate Machine Learning (ML) models.
Extensive experience on IT infrastructure related connectivity topics including but not limited to IP, VLAN, VPC, VPN.
Experience in creating and designing ETL chains.
Experience within server less (python, .NET) with knowledge on how to deal with data warehousing systems and understand how to set up the target database system.
Experience in preparing data for analytics and following a data science workflow.
Experience in workflow orchestration tools.




About The Team

The Data & Analytics organization has been established and designed to help Siemens Energy achieve our mission by becoming a data driven organization. Treating and using data as a strategic asset enables us to support customers in transitioning to a more sustainable world, by using innovative technologies and bringing ideas into reality.

Check out this video to see what we do here! https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo




Who is Siemens Energy?

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With more than 92,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.




Our Commitment to Diversity

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people with disabilities.

https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/jobs

Show more
HTML:
A Snapshot of Your Day

We’re looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join the new business operations team in ED&AA (Enterprise Data and Advanced Analytics). In a typical day you will be meeting colleagues in the business who are seeking solutions to new data challenges, to understand their challenges and devising an appropriate, high-quality architecture for engineers to implement. You will be also communicating with data engineering, AI, data science and data visualization colleagues on live projects, advising and trouble-shooting the implementation.


How You’ll Make An Impact / Responsibilities

  • Manage the data pipeline, connectivity and data transformation integrating machine learning models to optimize data pipelines to support projects.
  • Use state of the art technologies to acquire, ingest and transform big datasets, as well as using Python and SQL daily.
  • Responsible for the infrastructure models to catch data from the source, setting up requirements to extract data from restricted knowledge.
  • Responsible for the target database system and own data warehousing process.
  • Map data fields to hypothesis, curate, wrangle and prepare data to be used in advanced analytics models.
  • Progress work on ETL chains and jobs.
  • Create and manage data environments in the cloud or on premise.
  • Ensure information security standards are always maintained.
  • Contribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and clients.
  • Stay up to date with the latest developments in data science principle and with state-of-the-art technology to best support the business in making truly data driven decisions


What You Bring / Skills, Capabilities

  • Knowledge of software engineering concepts and an understanding of best practices.
  • Experience building data pipelines in production and ability to work across structured, semi-structured and unstructured data, as well as experience preparing data for analytics

and following a data science workflow.

  • Understand the peer review process and state of the art tech documentation.
  • Understand issues regarding connectivity, data transformation and be able to integrate Machine Learning (ML) models.
  • Extensive experience on IT infrastructure related connectivity topics including but not limited to IP, VLAN, VPC, VPN.
  • Experience in creating and designing ETL chains.
  • Experience within server less (python, .NET) with knowledge on how to deal with data warehousing systems and understand how to set up the target database system.
  • Experience in preparing data for analytics and following a data science workflow.
  • Experience in workflow orchestration tools.


About The Team

The Data & Analytics organization has been established and designed to help Siemens Energy achieve our mission by becoming a data driven organization. Treating and using data as a strategic asset enables us to support customers in transitioning to a more sustainable world, by using innovative technologies and bringing ideas into reality.

Check out this video to see what we do here! https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo


Who is Siemens Energy?

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With more than 92,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.


Our Commitment to Diversity

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people with disabilities.

https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/jobs

Title: Data Driven | Azure Data Engineer
HTML:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

We are currently looking for an Azure Data Engineer to work with us.
  • Create ingestion pipelines from various data sources;
  • Develop ETL processes, design database systems, and tools for both real-time and offline analytics;
  • Monitor and ensure data quality;
  • Ensure data availability for stakeholders and business processes;
  • Develop data models and structures for BI and Data Science teams;
  • Analyze and troubleshoot data-related issues and discrepancies;
  • Collaborate with analytics teams to foster data-driven decision-making.


Qualifications
  • Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets;
  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases;
  • Experience building and optimizing big data data pipelines, architectures, and data sets using Azure and Databricks;
  • Strong experience with Azure services including Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, and others;
  • Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement;
  • Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Additional Information

Nice to have
  • Experience with data visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau;
  • Experience with other cloud platforms like AWS or GCP;
  • Familiarity with machine learning toolkits and algorithms.


Does this sound like you?

Come build with us, innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.

Apply today!

 

Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: (Internal) Data Engineer - Lisbon
Description:
Description
Please note this role is a non-consulting position.

In this job you will develop and implement data pipelines on AWS, maintain and develop them further under guidance of business owners. You will work alongside Data Scientists, Data Engineers and others; integrated in our Product and Digital team. This role offers the chance to join Efficio at a pivotal point in our data journey, and to shape and influence our data landscape. We are looking for visionaries to build the future of procurement, join us!

This role gives you the opportunity to:


Collect business requirements and translate them into robust and scalable solutions
Demonstrate an understanding of DataOps and develop use case agnostic ETL pipelines
Take a proactive approach to work and become a go-to expert for data cloud migration
Work with state-of-the-art tooling on AWS including Redshift, S3 and ECS
Collaborate with our infrastructure engineers to provision the next generation of tools
Develop a sense of ownership to deliver high quality outcomes for the business
Make complex data more accessible, understandable, and usable by the organisation


Essential Requirements Required Skills:


An advanced degree in software engineering, computer science, a related technical field, or relevant work experience
Proven experience in building robust and reliable data pipelines, dealing with a wide variety of data sources
Strong experience in Python, knowledge of data wrangling methodologies and common packages
Proficiency with AWS Tools (e.g., S3, Athena, Glue, Lamba, Kinesis) as well as AWS CI/CD and readiness to learn/work with them
Experience with Docker, Airflow, and SQLs (ideally Postgres)
Fundamental understanding of programming landscape (e.g., APIs, SQL, database management)
Great communication skills, comfortable working collaboratively in cross-functional teams
Ability to manage own workload with a customer focus and solution orientated can-do attitude

Title: Data Engineer GCP
Description:
HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT? 

In collaboration with our data platform team and management, you will build data pipelines on our cloud platform and will contribute to bring our data projects to life.

In close collaboration with the various domain leads and data product owner, you will qualify needs and build solutions within GCP accordingly.

During Your Journey With Us You Will


Clean and transform raw data from various sources into reliable data products.
Implement tests to check the quality and reliability of the data.
Document the data products to ensure a global understanding of dimensions and key-figures.


As a Member Of Process Excellence Team, You Will

 


Apply software engineering best practices to analytics (version control, testing, continuous integration).
Propose, transform, and automate non added value processes.


 

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE ? 


University degree in computer science, data science, finance, math’s/ physics or comparable work experience
4+ years working in comparable engineering roles
Strong programming skills in Python and SQL and experience with Cloud Services (preferably in GCP): in our Tech Stack we use Terraform for Infrastructure as Code, BigQuery for data storage, Docker and Kubernetes for computing, Airflow for orchestration, and GitLab for CI/CD
First experiences with data visualization and data analysis tools such as Looker would be an advantage
Excellent written and verbal communication skills: Fluent in English, French is a plus

Title: Business Analyst Administrator (SQL)
Description:
Position Description

CGI is looking for a Business Analyst Administrator (SQL) to join our team.

Your future duties and responsibilities


Be a key participant with the external vendors and the internal IT teams within the hosting location of Paris as a point of contact in relation to technical matters;
Comply with and enforce the norms and standards in use: engineering, architecture and security norms and participate in best practice communities;
Conduct/Manage performance analysis and fine tuning of processes to minimize any potential adverse impact thus ensuring optimum efficiency of our existing infrastructure;
Liaise with IT Application Owner and Release Manager to ensure that most suitable technical solution is being put in place and is fully understood and documented;
Work with other members of the HFS IT team to ensure that interfaces with other applications and third party applications work as required.


Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Hard Skills:


Knowledge of system design, development, implementations, and user support principles and practices
Experience of querying SQL databases is essential, Mongo experience a plus
Experience with Linux and Windows, administration including day-to-day maintenance, troubleshooting and development is essential
Understanding of infrastructure, networks and systems connectivity (e.g. APIs)


Soft Skills:


Experience of working within a global organization and working with teams across a number of locations
Demonstrable ability to face challenges with an analytical approach and to find solutions to effectively solve problems
Ability to liaise with both internal and external parties at all levels in a professional and efficient manner
Capable and organized team player with excellent interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills, who shares ideas and best practice within the team and across the organization for the benefit of the business
Self-motivated and results focused


Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.
Show more

Title: Senior Power BI Specialist
Description:
We are excited to announce a new opportunity for a Senior Power BI Specialist to join our client, a global consulting firm specialising in Data & Analytics. As a member of a specialised team, you will work on local and global projects across various sectors, including healthcare, financial services, retail, consumer goods, automotive, public sector, telecommunications, and utilities.

In This Role, You Will Be Responsible For


Participating in global data analysis projects by designing technical and functional solutions that maximise the value of data
Developing solutions using Power Platform tools, primarily Power BI for report creation, as well as Power Automate and Power Apps
Creating ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and data models, with opportunities to work in cloud environments
Collaborating with internal teams and customers to identify and understand data analysis needs, delivering high-quality solutions
Enhancing your project and client management skills, with support to help you become a team and project leader


Who We Are Seeking


Academic background in Computer Engineering, Telecommunications, Information Management, or a related field
At least 5 years of experience working on projects with Power Platform tools, primarily Power BI and DAX, preferably with experience in consultancy
Solid Technical proficiency in data modeling and ETL processes
Some knowledge in data processing, preferably with Snowflake
Fluency in English for effective communication with international colleagues


If you are a strong team leader, passionate about data analysis, results-driven, and customer-focused, and believe this opportunity is right for you, please send your resume and contact information to ari.kilab@robertwalters.com
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're seeking a data analyst to provide insights necessary for planning, executing, and assessing customer initiatives aimed at business growth. You'll primarily support Sales Operations, Customer Support, and Customer Success departments within the Customer Data Intelligence cross-functional team.

Your new adventure:


Proficiency in organizing and analyzing data to derive meaningful insights
Thoroughness in data analysis and reporting to ensure the accuracy and reliability of insights
Proficient in working with relational databases
Drive analysis of segmented engagement models for a large and diverse customer base
Create clear and informative visuals and dashboards to present data insights effectively
Create value for stakeholders through reporting and analysing key metrics and answering their business needs
Capacity to find answers to complex questions and summarize insights relevant to business objectives
Support the creation and maintenance of customer analytics practice and foster a culture of insights-driven decision-making
Identify and promote a culture of continuous improvement
Demonstrate intellectual curiosity, logical thinking, and problem-solving skills for complex, ambiguous problems
Set and prioritize tasks aligned with company objectives and key results, and effectively communicate them to stakeholders
Actively participate in cross-team initiatives and promote a collaborative culture
Excellent communication skills to articulate findings and insights to various stakeholders clearly and concisely


Does this sound like you?


BS in mathematics, economics, computer science, information management or statistics
5+ years of experience in quantitative analysis, preferably for a tech company
Excellent, SQL skills and experience in working with relational databases
Excellent, Data visualization skills and experience with business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or similar software)
Experience with R/ Python and ML frameworks is a plus
Fluency in English


Why Pipedrive:


A value-driven work environment where people come first
A lively bunch of colleagues from over 50 different countries, with offices in Lisbon, Tallinn, Tartu, Prague, London, Dublin, New York, Florida, Riga and Berlin
A team serious about getting things done while not taking ourselves too seriously
A world-class working environment full of the usual nice perks and some more
Freedom to execute your ideas with a passionate and motivated team supporting you
Flexible working hours as long as you’re there for your team members
Lots of room for personal and career development, with internal and external training opportunities
Competitive salary including all the benefits you’d expect from a great employer (annual bonus system, health insurance, meal allowance, flexible benefits – you can choose whether to use the credit on parking, a public transport card, technology, etc.)


Pipedrive is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of age, gender, race, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

We’re on the lookout for a data analyst to develop and maintain regular reports, conduct advanced and independent analyses to segment our customer base, and collaborate closely with operations and data engineering teams on data management projects.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Explorer: Embark on Analysis Adventures! ⚙️

There's no secret for being number-one; it takes willingness to improve and determination to pursue it. At GRiT®, it’s all about the journey to get there. We believe talent and intelligence are important, yet passion and perseverance are the key to achieving any goal.

We are Tech Passionate People with a Purpose, delivering solutions while building strong long-term relations.

At GRiT®, we embrace inclusion and social responsibility, recognizing that each individual contributes uniquely to our collective success. We are committed to creating a diverse, respectful and inclusive environment.

People. Technology. Innovation. All-around it.

Are you GRiTTY enough to be part of our journey? Take the first step by applying now and let’s create our future together. 🌟

Must-Have


3 years minimum of experience as Data Analyst
Analytical mindset, being able to drive insights to answer business questions with data and visualizations
Knowledge of Data Transformation and analysis tools (SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, PowerQuery, PowerPivot, PowerBI, MDX, Python, SQL, R)
Experience creating and managing data warehouses, as well as the ETL/ETL workflow
Experience working with Engineering on ETL pipelines
Ability to organize, autonomy, dynamism, pro-activity and teamwork
Sense of responsibility
Strong written and verbal English communication skills


Would Be Great If You Have


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar
Effective visual communicator – you can communicate complex problems to business and technology stakeholders using visual collaboration tools
Background with Cloud Databases


What’s In It For You


Continuous Training and Certifications
GRiT Prizes: GRiT Baby Gift, GRiT Birthday Prize, GRiT Recommendation Prize
Exclusive Partnerships/Discounts: (Gym, Health, Well-being, Lifestyle, Financial, etc…)
Unique Events
Welcoming Office (Fruit, Coffee, Pool Table, etc.)
Competitive Compensation
Pay for Performance


#PassionInTech - Fuel your passion, join our tech tribe! 🫀

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Descrição da Empresa

O Clan é a primeira solução de emprego 100% digital para candidatos e colaboradores, desenvolvida pela Multipessoal. Através do Clan, é possível realizar e acompanhar online todos os passos da jornada dos profissionais, de uma forma inovadora, acessível, cómoda e ágil. Junta-te a nós em clan.pt

Descrição da Função

Descrição Our client is a global management consulting firm with a leading vision in the practices of Analytics, Business Intelligence, and Big Data. Responsabilidades - Acquire 360° knowledge of Data & Analytics: data architecture, data management, data visualization and data analysis; - Develop hard skills in the use of Business Intelligence technologies and soft skills to relate to the customer and their work team; - Ability to move and interact in an international, fast and dynamic environment gradually assuming greater responsibilities and autonomy in tasks. Requisitos - Bachelor/Master in a field that emphasizes data analysis and visualization (Computer Science, Information Management, Mathematics, Engineering or Statistics), or equivalent work experience; - Solid knowledge of SQL programming (or similar language aimed at querying relational databases); - Good written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills; - Excellent follow-through, commitment and accountability.

Localização


Lisboa, Portugal

Requisitos - Bachelor/Master in a field that emphasizes data analysis and visualization (Computer Science, Information Management, Mathematics, Engineering or Statistics), or equivalent work experience; - Solid knowledge of SQL programming (or similar language aimed at querying relational databases); - Good written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills; - Excellent follow-through, commitment and accountability.

Localização

Title: Digital Insight Analyst
Description:
Digital Insight Analysts required to join our Portugal team

The opportunity:

Digital Insight Analysts are required to join our Insight Teams to work on some of the world's largest, high scale eCommerce platforms and online customer journeys in our offices in Portugal (Lisbon and Porto). If you're looking to relocate to Portugal we can help out with visa and relocation; this would be a great opportunity due to continued growth and our ever expanding capabilities in Portugal.

Reporting to the Head of Customer Insight & Activation, you will be responsible for analysing digital behaviour in order to provide rich, actionable insight and recommendations to our clients. This is more than just an insight role; it’s an opportunity to help shape the digital strategies of the world’s leading brands and retailers!

What you’ll be doing:

Creating measurement plans that identify the customer behaviour to be tracked (you will work closely with our implementation analysts for this)
Establishing detailed reporting and visualisations that help our clients understand the performance of their digital channels
Using measurement tools to analyse visitor behaviour in detail, across a wide range of digital properties (websites, mobile applications, instore devices)
Creating detailed insight reports that cover key findings and recommendations
Presenting your findings to a senior-level client audience and helping them understand what it means for their business
Working with our internal UX and design teams to inform the creation of new websites and apps
Answering client queries and running training sessions with them

What we want from you:

Solid experience working as an insight/data analyst, ideally in an ecommerce setting (client or agency)
Advanced practical knowledge of Google Analytics, ideally including its Enhanced Ecommerce functionality
A proven track record of delivering large insight projects for leading B2C organisations
Numerically adept in using Excel (or similar) to analyse data
Previous experience supporting junior team members
Extensive experience working with senior client stakeholders
Effective time management and multitasking abilities

If you know some of this, even better:

Practical knowledge of visualisation tools such as Google Data Studio, Tableau and Qlikview (or proficiency in using R or Python packages for relevant visualisation).
Experience working with any of the following tools is a bonus: Adobe Analytics, Google Tag Manager, SessionCam, Decibel Insight, ContentSquare, Optimizely, Monetate, Qubit, HotJar, CrazyEgg

What we can offer you:

Alongside the opportunity to work with some of the most exciting brands around the world, we’ll also prioritise your career development and help you grow your skills. We’ll empower you to make a difference, allow you to be yourself, and respect who you are.

AT VML Enterprise Solutions

Our Enterprise Solutions division houses strategic consultants, creative and technical architects and skilled developers and operators that together help some of the world’s leading organisations to deliver outstanding digital experiences across all major routes to market worldwide: marketplaces, online retailers, D2C, B2B and social platforms. With over 4,200 experts in 55 operational centres across 34 countries, our capabilities span the entire buying journey from customer acquisition, through engagement, to conversion and loyalty, driving multi-channel growth for world-leading brands.

We work with some of the most exciting brands such as The Coca-Cola Company, EY, Bosch, Unilever, Ford, DFS, Mercedes-Benz, Johnson & Johnson, Nestlé, Sainsbury’s, Selfridges, Shell and Tiffany & Co. We’ve built over 500 platforms for brands and retailers and generate in excess of $29bn annually for our clients and work with over 50 strategic partners including Adobe, SAP, Salesforce, HCL, Shopify, Sitecore, BigCommerce, commerce tools and Acquia. Our reputation is based on our people, and we believe we have some of the best in the business.

As our business grows internationally, we’re looking for new people to join us on our journey to inspire and take a key role in shaping some of the best commerce solutions, services, and websites in the world. Working as a team, no problem is insurmountable; we share in our client’s successes and believe that anyone can show creative bravery no matter what their role is in the team.

In our Lisbon or Porto office, you’ll join a team of other specialists who are always ready to help each other. The team is part of our Enterprise Solutions network and works in coordination with our Local and EMEA client leads.

Title: Analista de Dados BI
Description:
A Securitas Direct é uma multinacional de origem sueca especializada na venda e monitorização de alarmes para residências e pequenos negócios. Com uma forte presença comercial em países da Europa e da América Latina, conta com mais de 5 milhões de clientes e mais de 28.000 colaboradores, em todo o mundo. Em Portugal, é Escolha do Consumidor pelo 9.º ano consecutivo e pretende reforçar a sua equipa com  1 Analista de Dados BI para Algés.

Principais responsabilidades

- Automatização de relatórios mediante a criação de Dashboards

- Estudos ad-hoc sobre o DWH Corporativo para ajuda de seguimento de projetos:


Análise e Criação de KPIs de Negócio
Prospeção e análise de novas variáveis
Criação de Dashboard de seguimento


- Entendimento de processos de Negócio, para uma posterior criação da lógica mediante a procedimentos em SQL e assim obter os KPIs de seguimento.

- Automatismos de processos de BI via processos em Python.

Perfil

- Curso Superior em Engenharia, Informática, Matemática, Estatística ou áreas afins

- Experiência mínima de 1-2 anos como consultor de projeto BI e Reporting, ou em funções similares
- Domínio da linguagem SQL e experiência com BBDD ( Oracle, Sybase, SQL Server, …)
- Experiência com ferramentas de Reporting sobre todo Power BI

- Conhecimento de ferramentas Open Source ( Phyton, R, …)

- Valorizamos conhecimentos de Hyperion

Oferecemos

- Contrato de Trabalho em empresa líder de mercado e em crescimento;
- Salário de acordo com a experiência demonstrada;

- Formação;

- Regime hibrido após formação;

- Dia de Aniversário;

- Seguro de Saúde;

- Parcerias/Protocolos com outras empresas.

Envia o teu CV!

Alvará 138C - MAI
